name: Path T Pancreas Body Tail
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  Tumors of the body of the pancreas arise between the left edge of the superior mesenteric-portal vein confluence and the left edge of the aorta.  Tumors of the tail of the pancreas arise to the left of the left edge of the aorta.

**Note 2:**  Islets of Langerhans are distributed throughout the pancreas; an islet tumor is coded according to the subsite of the pancreas in which the tumor arises if the information is available.

**Note 3:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1 or T2. You may use a physicianâs statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. If the tumor appears to be in the T1 or T2 categories, but no size or category is specified, assign TX.

**Note 4:**  For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

    Confined to pancreas
    Localized, NOS
rows:
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not stated or unknown
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not documented in patient record
Surgical resection of primary tumor done, size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary

In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive 
Pancreatic Intraepithelial Neoplasia III (PanInIII) 
PanIN-III classification
Tumor limited to pancreas, 2 cm or less in greatest dimension
Tumor limited to pancreas, more than 2 cm in greatest dimension

Tumor extends beyond pancreas, but 
WITHOUT involvement celiac axis or superior mesenteric artery

Extension to peripancreatic tissue, NOS
Fixation to adjacent structures, NOS

Ampulla of Vater
Blood vessel(s):
    Hepatic artery
    Portal vein
    Splenic artery/vein
    Superior mesenteric vein
Duodenum
Extrahepatic bile duct(s)
Kidney, NOS
Left adrenal (suprarenal) gland
Left kidney
Left ureter
Mesenteric fat
Mesentery
Mesocolon
Peritoneum
Retroperitoneal soft tissue (retroperitoneal space)
Spleen
Splenic flexure of colon

Stated as T3
Tumor involves celiac axis or superior mesenteric artery

Tumor is inseparable from the celiac axis or superior mesenteric artery

Aorta
Celiac artery
Colon (other than splenic flexure)
Diaphragm
Gallbladder
Ileum

Liver (including porta hepatis)

Right kidney

Stomach
Superior mesenteric artery

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4
Pathologic T is not defined for the specific site/histology

No pathologic evaluation of primary tumor
No surgical resection of primary tumor and there isn't a positive biopsy of the highest T
Only positive biopsy of tumor which is not the highest T 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
